an6.50:4.1: “Mendicants, when there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an6.50:4.2: When there is no ethical conduct, one who lacks ethics has destroyed a vital condition for right samādhi.
an6.50:4.3: When there is no right samādhi, one who lacks right samādhi has destroyed a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an6.50:4.4: When there is no true knowledge and vision, one who lacks true knowledge and vision has destroyed a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an6.50:4.5: When there is no disillusionment and dispassion, one who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an6.50:4.6: Suppose there was a tree that lacked branches and foliage.
an6.50:4.7: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would not grow to fullness.
an6.50:4.8: In the same way, when there is no sense restraint, one who lacks sense restraint has destroyed a vital condition for ethical conduct. …
an6.50:4.9: One who lacks disillusionment and dispassion has destroyed a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an6.50:5.1: When there is sense restraint, one who has sense restraint has fulfilled a vital condition for ethical conduct.
an6.50:5.2: When there is ethical conduct, one who has fulfilled ethical conduct has fulfilled a vital condition for right samādhi.
an6.50:5.3: When there is right samādhi, one who has fulfilled right samādhi has fulfilled a vital condition for true knowledge and vision.
an6.50:5.4: When there is true knowledge and vision, one who has fulfilled true knowledge and vision has fulfilled a vital condition for disillusionment and dispassion.
an6.50:5.5: When there is disillusionment and dispassion, one who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.
an6.50:5.6: Suppose there was a tree that was complete with branches and foliage.
an6.50:5.7: Its shoots, bark, softwood, and heartwood would all grow to fullness.
an6.50:5.8: In the same way, when there is sense restraint, one who has fulfilled sense restraint has fulfilled a vital condition for ethical conduct. …
an6.50:5.9: One who has fulfilled disillusionment and dispassion has fulfilled a vital condition for knowledge and vision of freedom.”
